titles.title: Term Limits bill
Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States limiting the number of consecutive terms members of the United States Senate and House of Representatives may serve.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 5/20/1993--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Limits Members of the House of Representatives to five consecutive terms and Members of the Senate to two consecutive terms.
